SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc27
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc27.View.Gui

Class Gui

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc27.View.Gui.Gui
All Implemented Interfaces:
View
public class Gui extends Object implements View
The Gui class is responsible for managing the graphical user interface of the game It implements the View interface and follows the singleton pattern to ensure only one instance is used This class handles scene switching, user interactions, and updates from the game server, displaying every update in the current scene

    • getInstance

      public static Gui getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the Gui class. If the instance does not exist, it creates a new one. This method is thread-safe, ensuring that only one instance of the Gui class is created.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the Gui class

    • initializing

      public void initializing() throws IOException
      Initializes the application by loading all scenes and their corresponding controllers. This method loads each scene specified in ScenePaths, creates a new Scene object, and maps each scene path to its respective Scene and Controller. The current controller is set to the controller for the starter scene.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during loading of the FXML files

    • run

      public void run()
      Executes the initial setup of the game scenes. This method sets the starter cards and chat in the StarterCardScene, and the objective cards and chat in the ObjectiveCardScene if the player is not reconnected.
      Specified by:
      run in interface View

    • switchScene

      public void switchScene(String scenePath) throws IOException
      Switches the current scene to the scene specified by the given path. This method updates the scene on the JavaFX application thread to ensure thread safety. Change the currentController to the controller of the new scene;
      Parameters:
      scenePath - the path of the scene to switch to
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the scene switch

    • getControllerFromName

      public GenericController getControllerFromName(String path)
      Parameters:
      path - is the path to the xml scene
      Returns:
      the SceneController of the path to the xml given

    • show

      public void show(ArrayList<ResourceCard> hand)
      Displays the given hand of resource cards in the current GUI controller if it is an instance of ManuscriptSceneController. This method updates the hand view in the controller using the latest data from the MiniModel.
      Specified by:
      show in interface View
      Parameters:
      hand - the hand of resource cards to be displayed

    • show

      public void show(ClientManuscript manuscript)
      Displays the given manuscript in the current GUI controller. This method updates the manuscript view and counters in the controller using the latest data from the MiniModel.
      Specified by:
      show in interface View
      Parameters:
      manuscript - the client manuscript data to be displayed

    • show

      public void show(ClientBoard board)
      Displays the given board as the MainClient Board. Notify the ManuscriptSceneController to update the view.
      Specified by:
      show in interface View
      Parameters:
      board - the new to be displayed

    • show

      public void show(ClientChat chat)
      Displays the given chat in the current GUI controller. This method updates the chat view in the controller using the latest data from the MiniModel. When a message is added to the chat, it is updated in all scenes where the chat is displayed.
      Specified by:
      show in interface View
      Parameters:
      chat - the client chat data to be displayed

    • show

      public void show(ClientMarket market)
      Displays the given market in the current GUI controller if it is an instance of ManuscriptSceneController. This method updates the market view in the controller using the latest data from the MiniModel.
      Specified by:
      show in interface View
      Parameters:
      market - the client market data to be displayed

    • stringFromSceneController

      public void stringFromSceneController(String string)
      Add a string to the messages queue, used to talk with the server. These will be taken by the read.
      Parameters:
      string - the input to send to the server

    • okAck

      public void okAck(String string)
      Handles an "Ok" acknowledgment by logging the message and passing it to the current controller. If a current controller is set, it logs the "Ok" message and delegates the handling to the controller's method.
      Specified by:
      okAck in interface View
      Parameters:
      string - the acknowledgment message to be handled

    • koAck

      public void koAck(String string)
      Handles a "Ko" acknowledgment by logging the message and passing it to the current controller. If a current controller is set, it logs the "Ko" message and delegates the handling to the controller's method.
      Specified by:
      koAck in interface View
      Parameters:
      string - the acknowledgment message to be handled

    • showWinners

      public void showWinners()
      Displays the winners of the game by updating the ending scene with the score board. This method ensures that the user interface is updated on the JavaFX application thread. The scene is switched to the ending scene.
      Specified by:
      showWinners in interface View

    • addLastChatMessage

      public void addLastChatMessage(ChatMessage message, javafx.scene.control.Tab chatTab)
      Adds the chat message as the last chat message to the specified chat tab. This method updates the user interface to display the new message, aligning it appropriately based on the sender and receiver. If the message is a global message, the sender's name is displayed. The method runs on the JavaFX application thread to ensure thread safety when updating the UI components.
      Parameters:
      message - the chat message to be added
      chatTab - the tab in which the message should be displayed

    • isServerIsUp

      public boolean isServerIsUp()
      Returns whether the server is up
      Returns:
      true if the server is up, false otherwise
